description.narrative: The following development benefits are expected: (i) Mobilize up to EUR47.5 million via the risk sharing facility; (ii) Increase access to finance for renewable energy projects, which will lead to a sizeable and measurable reduction in GHG emissions; (iii) Reduce the countrys dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas. (iv) Support development of local SMEs, increase the number of renewable energy clients and contribute to employment generation. (v) Directly support the governments strategy of promoting renewable energy. (vi) Create a replicable facility to be used in lower income European countries.

The project entails a Risk Sharing Facility of up to EUR47.5 million (in local currency equivalent) with Ceska Sporitelna (Ceska or the Bank) to support increasing exposure to renewable energy (RE) sector.
As the former Czech state savings bank, Ceska Sporitelna has a large retail base and provides a growing range of financial services primarily focusing on small and medium-sized companies, municipalities, towns and large corporations.
IFC has had a long-standing commitment and experience in promoting energy efficiency investment in the region. This Facility builds upon the ITFs Commercializing Energy Efficiency Program (CEEF) launched in 2003. CEEF has since provided technical assistance and subsidized risk sharing for local banks using financial products and technical advisory to increase funding to renewable energy and energy efficiency projects.
